Health & Human Body.name: Anatomy Explorers
Health & Human Body.description: Delve into the fascinating world of the human body! This quiz tests your knowledge of teeth, medical procedures, and common diseases. Are you ready to explore the inner workings of the human form?

questions.text: Excluding wisdom teeth, how many adult teeth do humans have?
questions.hint: Consider the number of teeth in a typical adult smile, minus the third molars.

questions.text: The process of drilling holes in the skull is called what?
questions.hint: This ancient medical procedure was used to treat head injuries or release spirits.

questions.text: What disease is characterized by a body's inability to properly metabolize glucose?
questions.hint: This condition often requires monitoring blood sugar levels.

questions.text: Which of these foods is poisonous to dogs?
questions.hint: This sweet treat contains theobromine, which is toxic to canines.

questions.text: What condition is caused by malfunctioning sebaceous glands?
questions.hint: This common skin issue often affects teenagers and involves clogged pores.

questions.text: In an adult human, how long is the large intestine?
questions.hint: This organ is shorter than the small intestine but still spans several feet.

questions.text: The common term for someone who has difficulty seeing objects in the distance is what?
questions.hint: This condition makes faraway objects blurry, often corrected with glasses or contacts.

questions.text: What is the more common name for the disease 'pertussis'?
questions.hint: This illness is known for a distinctive, persistent cough in children.

Health & Human Body.name: Body Chemistry Challenge
Health & Human Body.description: Test your understanding of pH levels, food safety, and skeletal structure. This quiz will challenge your knowledge of the chemical and physical aspects of the human body and the world around us.

questions.text: What does a pH level measure?
questions.hint: This property determines whether a substance is acidic or basic.

questions.text: Someone would most likely contract salmonella poisoning from eating which of the following?
questions.hint: This food is a common source of bacterial contamination if undercooked.

questions.text: How many ribs are there in the human body?
questions.hint: Humans have pairs of ribs, typically 12 on each side of the chest.

Health & Human Body.name: Calcium & Cataracts
Health & Human Body.description: From bone density to eye health, this quiz explores vital components of the human body. Discover the roles of calcium, the process of disease identification, and the intricacies of the eye.

questions.text: The majority of calcium in the human body is found where?
questions.hint: This part of the body provides structural support and stores minerals.

questions.text: What is the medical term for a doctor's identification of a disease?
questions.hint: This term is used when a doctor determines the cause of a patient’s symptoms.

questions.text: What is your hallux?
questions.hint: This body part is the largest of its kind on your foot.

questions.text: What does an animal produce when it lactates?
questions.hint: This substance is a primary food source for mammalian young.

questions.text: What is the colored part of the eye called?
questions.hint: This part of the eye determines its visible color, like blue or brown.

questions.text: If someone has cataracts, what part of their body might need an operation?
questions.hint: Cataracts affect vision, clouding a specific part of the visual system.

questions.text: What is varicella?
questions.hint: This childhood illness causes itchy spots and is preventable by vaccine.

questions.text: What disease does a carcinogen cause?
questions.hint: This disease involves uncontrolled cell growth and can affect various organs.

Health & Human Body.name: Halloween Health & Hilarity
Health & Human Body.description: A quirky mix of health trivia and astrological fun! This quiz combines medical knowledge with a touch of Halloween spirit. Can you handle the spooky science?

questions.text: What is your astrological sign if you were born on Halloween?
questions.hint: Halloween falls in late October, near the cusp of two zodiac signs.

questions.text: What part of the human body does a gastroenterologist examine?
questions.hint: This specialist focuses on the digestive system, particularly one key organ.

questions.text: Which of these foods is poisonous to dogs?
questions.hint: This sweet treat contains theobromine, which is toxic to canines.

questions.text: What is the medical term for a doctor's identification of a disease?
questions.hint: This term is used when a doctor determines the cause of a patient’s symptoms.

questions.text: What is the more common name for the disease 'pertussis'?
questions.hint: This illness is known for a distinctive, persistent cough in children.
